oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of a dark brick structure with windows on both sides and a columned front porch. A worn-down basketball court with two goalposts stands in the side yard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This "negro" school had two classrooms, two teachers, 107 students, and was in session for 8 months per year. The average daily attendance for students was 89.5%. The school, according to the scorecard application for the classification of approved rural elementary schools, received a score of 82 out of a total of 100. Information on the school's teachers, facilities, community, administration, pupils, and more can be seen on this form. The school did not have a gymnasium,
